result.execSummary:
Robert J Mardon was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Robert J Mardon was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert J Mardon

records.addlTxt:
9:00 AM Defendant Robert J Mardon not in court.  Attorney Georgia L. Konstantakis not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Lucas P. Bennewitz in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter:  Nancy Szeklinski. 
Defendant has been extradited.
BTC: Case dismissed.

10:23 AM Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Robert J Mardon in court, in custody.  Attorney Georgia L. Konstantakis in court for Robert J Mardon. Court Reporter:  Nancy Szeklinski. 
State of Illinois req extradition.
Defendant does not contest.
Colloquy conducted with def re: right to hearing.
BTC:  The court finds that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly, & intelligently waives extradition.

State of Illinois req extradition.
Defendant does not contest.
Colloquy conducted with def re: right to hearing.
BTC:  The court finds that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly, & intelligently waives extradition.
Status conference scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.
